overview: From 2025-11-27 to 2025-11-28, ethereum-optimism/optimism had 14 new PRs (4 merged), 27 new issues, and 22 active contributors.

topIssues.title: op deployer with custom intent (faultGameClockExtension, faultGameMaxClockDuration)  reverts
topIssues.author: InoMurko
topIssues.body:
My guess is that op deployer for some reason does not like modified   
faultGameClockExtension = 3600
faultGameMaxClockDuration = 14400

because if standard are used, then deployment works:
  faultGameClockExtension = 10800
  faultGameMaxClockDuration = 302400


**Bug Description**
Using op-deployer with a custom intent file:
```
configType = "custom"
l1ChainID = 84532
fundDevAccounts = false
l1ContractsLocator = "https://storage.googleapis.com/oplabs-contract-artifacts/artifacts-v1-b112b16f8939fbb732c0693de3d3bd1e8e3e2f0771f91d5ab300a6c9b7b1af73.tar.gz"
l2ContractsLocator = "https://storage.googleapis.com/oplabs-contract-artifacts/artifacts-v1-b112b16f8939fbb732c0693de3d3bd1e8e3e2f0771f91d5ab300a6c9b7b1af73.tar.gz"

[superchainRoles]
  SuperchainProxyAdminOwner = "0x4da3c5d00ffd28c0c1b8f92d1720e722ea5f2fbf"
  SuperchainGuardian = "0x4da3c5d00ffd28c0c1b8f92d1720e722ea5f2fbf"
  ProtocolVersionsOwner = "0x4da3c5d00ffd28c0c1b8f92d1720e722ea5f2fbf"
  Challenger = "0x267dbd8ed34722e59639224ae3c5360a46328403"

[[chains]]
  id = "0x00000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000002dddf153b"
  baseFeeVaultRecipient = "0x4da3c5d00ffd28c0c1b8f92d1720e722ea5f2fbf"
  l1FeeVaultRecipient = "0x4da3c5d00ffd28c0c1b8f92d1720e722ea5f2fbf"
  sequencerFeeVaultRecipient = "0x4da3c5d00ffd28c0c1b8f92d1720e722ea5f2fbf"
  eip1559DenominatorCanyon = 250
  eip1559Denominator = 50
  eip1559Elasticity = 6
  gasLimit = 60000000
  operatorFeeScalar = 0
  operatorFeeConstant = 0
  minBaseFee = 0
  daFootprintGasScalar = 0
  [chains.roles]
    l1ProxyAdminOwner = "0x4da3c5d00ffd28c0c1b8f92d1720e722ea5f2fbf"
    l2ProxyAdminOwner = "0x5eb4c5d00ffd28c0c1b8f92d1720e722ea5f40d0"
    systemConfigOwner = "0x4da3c5d00ffd28c0c1b8f92d1720e722ea5f2fbf"
    unsafeBlockSigner = "0xefd8e9ebae282bae1dd40e652dcdaac46f7224fb"

    eip1559Denominator = 50
    enableGovernance = false
    gasPriceOracleBaseFeeScalar = 1101
    gasPriceOracleBlobBaseFeeScalar = 659851
    l1FeeVaultMinimumWithdrawalAmount = "0xde0b6b3a7640000"
    l1FeeVaultWithdrawalNetwork = "remote"

    sequencerFeeVaultMinimumWithdrawalAmount = "0xde0b6b3a7640000"

[globalDeployOverrides]

  dangerouslyAllowCustomDisputeParameters = true

```

  "version": 1,
  "create2Salt": "0x76569cb1c4458a1c5603366c1ff403893c3af1de18e15aa68f8fa5a2fa31d9d0",

topIssues.title: Runbook Routing
topIssues.author: Inphi
topIssues.body:
Document a process for figuring out which Runbook to use for the Proofs system.
In particular, it should be clear, based on on-chain information, which runbook to use for any given proofs deployment.

topIssues.title: Remove alt-da support
topIssues.author: pauldowman
topIssues.body:
The OP Stack doesn't support alt DA currently so we should remove it. We don't want to keep unused code around because it's a maintenance burden and confuses people into thinking it's supported. 

It may make sense to keep the abstractions around the DA layer, on the other hand see the above paragraph... if it's not going to be used we can add it back in the future.

topPRs.title: op-interop-filter: Service skeleton with flags and metrics
topPRs.author: karlfloersch
topPRs.body:
---------

<!--
Contributions welcome! See https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/.github/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

**Description**

Adds the op-interop-filter service skeleton:
1. CLI flags with StringSliceFlag for `--l2-rpcs` (chain ID queried from RPC)
2. Service lifecycle (start/stop) following op-service patterns
3. RPC server with supervisor namespace for `checkAccessList`
4. Metrics with `doc` subcommand for documentation
5. Stub backend (actual logic in follow-up PR)

This service validates interop executing messages for op-geth/op-reth transaction filtering. Any reorg triggers failsafe which disables all interop transactions.

**Tests**

Unit tests will be added in the follow-up logic PR. This skeleton PR focuses on service structure.

topPRs.title: op-challenger: Update list-games sub command to support optimistic zk games
topPRs.author: ajsutton
topPRs.body:
**Description**

Starts to build out the OptimisticZK contract bindings and make challenger not require everything to look like a FaultDisputeGame. Chose to make the ZK contracts independent rather than trying to have a base class with shared code - the hierarchy of versions of `FaultDisputeGame` are already pretty complex and the method call implementations are generally pretty mechanical so better to keep the implementation simple at the cost of some code duplication. Especially since these methods haven't needed to change much outside of actual contract implementation changes.

There is however a hierarchy of contract interfaces so that we can have a single constructor method that creates the right bindings per game type with a generic interface returned and then can check if more specific interfaces are supported conditionally when required. That will be most useful for dispute-mon but is also used for the claim count value in list-games which doesn't apply to ZK games.

A new game type is introduced for optimistic ZK games, but a corresponding trace type doesn't exist yet - that can follow when actually supporting challenging the games. For now we just need to be able to handle the game type so we can fetch the metadata for list-games.

**Tests**

Added unit tests for the new bindings.


**Metadata**

fixes #18392

topPRs.title: feat: remove CGT dev feature flag
topPRs.author: agusduha
topPRs.body:
**Description**

Removes the `CUSTOM_GAS_TOKEN` dev feature flag and switches all usage to system/config-based toggles, updating CI, deployer, and tests accordingly.


**Tests**

- Replace `skipIfDevFeature` CGT checks with system-level toggles (`setUseCustomGasToken(true)` or `enableCustomGasToken()`).
- Add/rename CGT-specific test contracts and update test exclusions list.
- Add CGT-mode variants for `OptimismPortal2.depositTransaction/finalizeWithdrawal` and `L2ToL1MessagePasser` tests.

**Additional context**

Following https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/18076

topPRs.title: op-challenger: Move GameType to the game/type package instead of game/fault/type
topPRs.author: ajsutton
topPRs.body:
**Description**

Game types are not specific to fault dispute games. As we introduce ZK games we want to maintain good separation between the fault dispute game handling code and the zk game handling code.



**Metadata**

#18321

topPRs.title: op-acceptance: Add acceptance tests for withdrawals using cannon and cannon_kona
topPRs.author: ajsutton
topPRs.body:
**Description**

Triplicates the withdrawal test creating versions that uses PERMISSIONED, CANNON and CANNON_KONA game types.

Sadly each test has to be in a different package so it can get a different system configuration (with the appropriate respected game type)
